doc.previous: Note that factors p0 1 may be inserted without changing the value of n e g 1000 23 30 53 In fact any positive integer can be uniquely represented as an infinite product taken over all the positive prime numbers
doc.after: where a finite number of the ni are positive integers and the rest are zero Allowing negative exponents provides a canonical form for positive rational numbers
